sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: MySQL is a widely spread, multi-threaded, multi-user SQL database, developed by Oracle.

sections.title: Installation
sections.content:
Arch Linux favors MariaDB, a community-developed fork of MySQL, aiming for drop-in compatibility.

Oracle's MySQL was dropped to the AUR: mysqlAUR.

Another fork aiming to be fully compatible is Percona Server, available as percona-server.

The InnoDB storage engine by Oracle was also forked by Percona as XtraDB. The fork is used by both MariaDB and Percona Server.

sections.title: Graphical tools
sections.content:
- phpMyAdmin — MySQL web interface, written in PHP.

- MySQL Workbench — Unified visual tool for database architects, developers, and DBAs. Developed by Oracle and not guaranteed to work with MariaDB.

For tools supporting multiple DBMSs, see List of applications/Documents#Database tools.

sections.title: Console tools
sections.content: - MyCLI — A terminal client for MySQL with autocompletion and syntax highlighting.

sections.title: Programmatic access
sections.content:
- JDBC and MySQL
- PHP#MySQL/MariaDB
- Python python-mysqlclient python-mysql-connector
- C++ mysql++
- Perl perl-dbd-mysql
- Ruby ruby-mysql2AUR

- python-mysqlclient
- python-mysql-connector

- mysql++

- perl-dbd-mysql

- ruby-mysql2AUR

sections.title: Docker
sections.content: A docker image is available: https://hub.docker.com/_/mysql

sections.title: Cannot connect to local MySQL server through socket
sections.content: If running a new container fails to start, you may need to increase the ulimit. See GitHub issue for more information.
